title: Workshop on Developing a Language Instructional Design Model Based on Multiple Intelligence Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Language education experience and understanding of basic instructional design theories
context.additional_context: Current practitioners design language education programs and learn expert validation processes using Delphi research methods.

learning_goals: Learners can present three or more practical strategies for applying the eight elements of multiple intelligences to language education design.
Learners can explain step-by-step procedures for validating instructional design models using the Delphi research methodology.
Learners can develop customized instructional design models optimized for the linguistic characteristics of target learners and BYOD environments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
